TopicTitle: [Video] Kerbal Space Program Halloween Special Episode

Articles.Content:
A fun little short I created featuring Jeb, Bill and Bob.

Does this have "sticky" potential?

Some cool video editing there, the lightning effects were pretty smart
Thank you. It took a a good bit of effort to make this little 6 minute video. But it was a lot of fun.

Nice video, good editing! Small nitpick, "MÃƒÂ¼n" would rhyme with "tune", not with "bun". Other than that though, very cute.

I chuckled at Jeb's voice. I can do that voice too. People say it sounds like Slimer from the Ghostbusters cartoon.

Nice video, good editing! Small nitpick, "MÃƒÂ¼n" would rhyme with "tune", not with "bun". Other than that though, very cute.

I chuckled at Jeb's voice. I can do that voice too. People say it sounds like Slimer from the Ghostbusters cartoon.

Haha awesome! I was going for a Meatwad voice. Thanks for the post.

I really enjoyed this. Great work!

Cheers!

I really enjoyed this. Great work!

Cheers!

Thank you.
Love the "yo' mama" joke in there.
Great video. Only criticism is that i didn't quite understand why they kept enabling and disabling their RCS packs while they were talking. Also, there are no sounds (creepy or otherwise) in space.

Great video. Only criticism is that i didn't quite understand why they kept enabling and disabling their RCS packs while they were talking. Also, there are no sounds (creepy or otherwise) in space.

I assume it was to indicate that they were talking, using "hand gestures".
Wow, just wow, very nice. One of the better KSP videos out there for sure.

Great video. Only criticism is that i didn't quite understand why they kept enabling and disabling their RCS packs while they were talking. Also, there are no sounds (creepy or otherwise) in space.

Thank you. A few things. I was doing the RCS thing to simulate talking as they would other wise just be standing still. And second I know that space is a vacuum and sound can't travel very far. The sounds where for effect. To add color to a blank canvas one might say.

I assume it was to indicate that they were talking, using "hand gestures".

This is exactly correct!
love it, seems to be alot of good stuff on the youtube recently

love it, seems to be alot of good stuff on the youtube recently

Thanks! I'm thinking about doing another one.
